ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT:
A transformer with 800 primary turns and 200 secondary turns is supplied from a 100 V a.c supply.
The secondary voltage is
A 3300/250 V, 50 Hz, single phase transformer is built on a core having an effective cross-sectional area of 125 cm2 and 70 turns on the low voltage winding. The value of maximum flux density is

Which of the following statments are correct regarding ideal transformer?
1. Primary and secondary winding resistances are negligible.
2. The core has infinite permeability.
3. Leakage flux and leakage inductances are zero.
4. There are no losses due to resistance, hysteresis and eddy currents.

A 230/110 V single phase transformer takes an input of 350 VA at no load and at rated voltage.
The core loss is 110 W. The iron loss component of no load current is

A 1-phase transformer has 180 and 90 turns respectively in its secondary and primary windings.
The respective resistances are 0.233 Ω and 0.067 Ω. The total resistance of the transformer referred to the primary side is
A transformer has 2 percent resistance and 5 percent reactance. The voltage regulation at full load, 0.8 power factor, lagging is

In a transformer, the core loss is 100 W at 40 Hz and 72 W at 30 Hz. The hysteresis and eddy current losses at 50 Hz is
1. Hysteresis loss = 25 W
2. Hysteresis loss = 105 W
3. Eddy current loss = 25 W
4. Eddy current loss = 105 W
Which of the following is/are correct?

The following results were obtained on a 50 kVA, 2400/120 V transformer: Open circuit Test
performed on L.V side:
Wattmeter reading = 396 W
Ammeter reading = 9.65 A
Voltmeter reading = 120 V
Short circuit test performed on H.V side:
Wattmeter reading = 810 W
Ammeter reading = 20.8 A
Voltmeter reading = 92 V
The efficiency at full load, 0.8 power factor lagging is

Which of the following are correct regarding autotransformers?
1. An autotransformer uses less winding material than a 2-winding transformer.
2. An autotransformer is smaller in size and cheaper than the two winding transformer of the same output.
3. An auto transformer has less efficiency than the equivalent 2-winding transformer.
4. Voltage regulation of the autotransformer is inferior than the 2-winding transformer.
If the highest speed at which a 50 Hz and 60 Hz alternator can be operated are given by N1 and N2, then which of the following relations are correct?

A 3-phase, 50 Hz, 8 poles alternator has a star connected winding with 120 slots and 8 conductors per slot. The flux per pole is 0.05 Wb, which is sinusoidally distributed. Assuming the full pitch coil, the phase voltage is
(given sin 6° = 0.1045)

A 500 V, 50 kVA single phase alternator has an effective armature resistance of 0.2 Ω. An excitation current of 10 A produces 200 A armature current on short circuit and an emf of 450 V on open circuit. The synchronous reactance is

The power input to a 3 phase induction motor is 60 kW. The stator losses total 1 kW. The total mechanical power developed if the motor is running with a slip of 3% is
A 6 pole, 50 Hz, 3 Φ induction motor running on full load develops a useful torque of 150 Nm at a rotor frequency of 1.5 Hz. The shaft power output is
The stator loss of a 3-Φ induction motor is 2 kW. When the power input is 90 kW, what will be the rotor mechanical power developed if the motor is running with a slip of 4%?

A 6 pole, 3Φ, 50 Hz induction motor runs on full load with a slip of 4 per cent. Given the rotor standstill impedance per phase as (0.01 + j0.05)Ω, the available maximum torque in terms of full load torque is
A 4 pole, wave wound armature has 720 conductors and is rotated at 1000 rev/minute. If the useful flux is 20 mWb, the generated voltage is
An 8 pole lap connected armature having 40 slots with 12 conductors per slot generates a voltage of 500 V. The speed at which it is running if the flux per pole is 50 mWb is
A shunt generator gives full load output of 30 kW at a terminal voltage of 200 V. The armature and shunt field resistances are 0.05 Ω and 50 Ω respectively. The copper loss is
The armature resistance of a 200 V shunt motor is 0.4 Ω and no load current is 2 A. When loaded and taking an armature current of 50 A, the speed is 1200 rpm. The approximate no load speed is
A single phase 100 kVA, 2000/200 V, 50 Hz transformer has an impedance drop of 10% and resistance drop of 5%. The value of power factor at which voltage regulation is zero is

A transformer is rated at 100 kVA. At full load, its copper loss is 1200 W and its iron loss is 960 W.
The load kVA at which maximum efficiency will occur is

A 4 pole ac machine has a 3 phase winding wound in 60 slots. The coils are short pitched in such a way that if one coil side lies in slot number 1, the other side of the same coil lies in slot number 13. The short-pitch angle for the given coil is
A 12 pole, 3 phase alternator is coupled to an engine running at 500 rpm. It supplies an induction motor which has a full load speed of 1440 rpm. The number of the poles of the motor is

A 3 phase induction motor has a 4 pole, star connected stator windings. The motor runs on a 50 Hz supply with 200 V between lines. The rotor resistance and standstill rotor reactance per phase are 0.1 Ω and 0.9 Ω respectively. The slip at maximum torque is

It is desired to install a 3 phase cage induction motor restricting the maximum line current drawn from a 400 V 3 phase supply to 120 A. If the starting current is 6 times full load current, what is maximum permissible full load kVA of the motor when it is directly connected to the mains?
Choose a wrong statement from the following on dc machines:
ENGLISH.OPT1: Function of yoke is to provide mechanical support for poles.
ENGLISH.OPT2: Poles are laminated to reduce hysteresis losses.
ENGLISH.OPT3: Commutator collects current from armature coils.

Which of the plants is suitable for peak load?

ENGLISH.OPT2: low voltage direct current electrical energy
ENGLISH.OPT3: low voltage alternating current electrical energy

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: A prime mover (PM) drives a 6 pole, 3Φ induction frequency converter. The converter is fed with 60 Hz, 3Φ supply on primary. If the PM speed is 3000 rpm, the frequencies of the possible outputs from converter are

A 200/400 V, 20 kVA, 50 Hz transformer is connected as an auto transformer to work off 600/200 V supplies. With a load of 20 kVA, 0.8 pf lagging connected to the 200V terminals, the current in common winding and kVA rating of auto transformer respectively are
If a transformer is designed to have maximum efficiency of 97% at full load and reactance of transformer is 0.1 pu. Then, voltage regulation at 0.8 pf lagging is ________%.

Statement (I): Short circuit test serves the purpose of determing the series parameters of a transformer.
Statement (II): Short circuit test is carried out on a transformer to determine the full load copper loss.
ENGLISH.EASSY_DETAILS:
Each of the next Two (2) items consists of two statements, one labelled as the ‘Statement (I)’ and the other as ‘Statement (II)’. You are to examine these two statements carefully and select the answers to these items using the codes given below:
Codes:
(a) Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are individually true and Statement (II) is the correct explanation of Statement (I).
(b) Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are individually true but Statement (II) is NOT the correct explanation of Statement (I).
(c) Statement (I) is true but Statement (II) is false.
(d) Statement (I) is false but Statement (II) is true.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT:
Statement (I): Induction generators are used as a accessories to systems supplying a load of fairly high power factor such as substations equipped with synchronous converters or motors.
Statement (II): An induction generator cannot generate reactive volt amperes.
ENGLISH.EASSY_DETAILS:
Each of the next Two (2) items consists of two statements, one labelled as the ‘Statement (I)’ and the other as ‘Statement (II)’. You are to examine these two statements carefully and select the answers to these items using the codes given below:
Codes:
(a) Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are individually true and Statement (II) is the correct explanation of Statement (I).
(b) Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are individually true but Statement (II) is NOT the correct explanation of Statement (I).
(c) Statement (I) is true but Statement (II) is false.
(d) Statement (I) is false but Statement (II) is true.
